reviewDescription: This is a great product if your dentist has advised you NOT to use a toothpaste that also has whitening, If you have sensitivity, then you probably should not be using even a gentle whitening toothpaste more than one a week or so. Consult your dentist.

reviewDescription: Listen this is easy. If v you have sensitive teeth then to know how painful it is. Eat cold foods including  drinking cold drinks.  Its embarrassing actually to say "I can't because my teeth are sensitive"  or "my teeth hurt"  Wearing down tooth enamel can come from brushing to hard, eating acidic foods and or whiting too much and the old school braces. But it comes from poor care of your teeth too.  Yes Sensodine is pricy but  if you try it you will never go back. Besides read about tooth paste. Its not truly good for your teeth. Florida etc. After one brushing you'll recognize the difference. This is a really good price for 4 tubes.Anyhow great stuff I honestly love this specific flavor and texture.  Works the best for me. I believe this is the original. There is no other substitute of a sensitive toothpaste. Trust me I've tried. Other brands just are not the same. Hence the price but im worth it. I squeeze every drop out ! Happy brushing
reviewTitle: hooked on Sensodine. There is no other

reviewDescription: Tooth paste, is it a subjective necessity or is one as good as the other. A few years back, my dentist suggested the Sensodyne brand, but also strongly suggested using a brand that included 5% potassium nitrate for sensitivity issues that may arise as I age. Bouncing between brands and even Sensodyne products I finally settled on Sensodyne Fresh Mint. Using in conjunction with Kimz Natural Bamboo toothbrushes, my teeth remain pretty darn clean, and have had no issues at all, which is important during this whole Covid issue that has gripped the country. Three pack is also thrifty. As much as I’d like to buy local, saving two bucks a tube is a no brainer. Good toothpaste, and I would highly recommend.
reviewTitle: Good for Taking Care of the Ivories

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021

reviewDescription: This Sensodyne Fresh Mint toothpaste is a waste of money! It is very "watery" and runs down your electric toothbrush and dribbles out of your mouth when you are brushing with an electric toothbrush. It turns "watery" when using a regular toothbrush also. Your teeth "do not" feel clean after using. The other Sensodyne brands that I have used helped me to not have any sensitivity in my teeth or gums. The sensitivity in my gums increased with this brand. Also, much to my chagrin, my teeth are duller looking! To say that I am "NOT" pleased with that, is putting it mildly! I have used Sensodyne Toothpaste on and off for years, and "exclusively" since January of 2020. I have "always" had good results with other Sensodyne brands, but my experience with the Sensodyne Fresh Mint toothpaste has been a horrible experience! Unless you want duller looking teeth and sensitive gums, I would stay away from this brand of Sensodyne!
